question: Students should choose a university major that prepares them for high-paying careers. To what extend do you agree with this statement.
text: Education and employment rate has changed a lot from the last couple of year. Many Undergraduates are now thinking to pursue  higher education in  colleges, who can train them for affluent salaries. Although, a wealthy lifestyle is much important nowadays, however, I disagree with the above statement and I will outline both arguments, will provide my opinion in the following essay.

Affluent income brings wealth for future and for future generations. With High ,salaried individuals can buy things they want and can fulfil the desires of their families. For example, if parents’ salaries are high students can go for better education in good colleges, which will help them to achieve higher goals. Universities help students to provides good placements in big companies. Therefore, choosing a high-end university can be a brilliant idea to bring fortune in future.

Nevertheless, there are certain factors which can bring high salaries, even though, one is not studying in major universities. Firstly, passion can bring any business  down to the top. If there is a passion inside a person to do something, there can reach the goal where they want, does not matter from which college he studied. To illustrate it more, A writer who has the passion to write can write far better than a content writer who is working, unsatisfactory in a 9 am to 5 pm job, only for few errands. If one does not have a passion for work, they may end up with mental illness and stress-related problems. Another Major factor is satisfaction. Satisfaction not only brings a healthy mindset but only increase  efficiency in work. As a result, Individuals can bring more power to work and can bring more money in their life.

In conclusion, Students believe that major colleges with providing high income are a wonderful choice. In my view, if a person has a passion for work, they can increase the business low to top, no matter which university they studied.
